content.description:
Face climb through pods and cracks beneath the roof. Long reaches between edges on the left line of the roof will get you through the crux to rejoin

Vagini

.
content.location:
Start just uphill of the fixed line. This shares a start and finish with

Vagini

but veers left under the roof.

content.description: Face climb through pods and cracks beneath the roof. High step move through the break in the roof to a nice pocketed face leading to the chains.
content.location: Begin just uphill of the fixed line. Climb up under the roof and take the righthand bolt line through a break. Climb back left to a ledge and a pocketed face to the shared anchor.

content.description:
This is a touch harder than its neighbor,

Groove Town

. A compression start off the ground followed by a tricky move leads to more fun, jug hauling. This route and

Groove Town

(just to the left) converge at the 3rd bolt. Unlike

Groove Town

, you'll need a stick clip for the first bolt to avoid a nasty tumble into the creek.

Groove Town

shares the 3rd and 4th bolts of this route along with the anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolts, a stick clip is advised for the first to avoid a swim.
content.location:
This is the right one of the two lowest routes down by the water at Low Wire. As the guidebook shows a picture from across the creek, this and Groove Town are technically the two farthest right routes in the Low Wire area, even though they are all the way down by the water.

This route is the closest you'll get to climbing over the water at Low Wire.

Head down the fixed line to a nice staging area, then scramble down to another staging area just below and closer to the water. (If you are looking up the fixed line, this area is down to the right by the water.)

content.description:
Good, vertical climbing to horizontals will get you to the anchors.

If you are little adventurous, you can also pre-hang this route by climbing the 5.9 called "

Fly High

" (the route found just before you rap down the fix line) and traversing more to the left on the good horizontals instead of heading up at the first exit to the intended anchors for

Fly High

/

Fly Low

routes.
content.location:
To get to Land of the Lost and the other routes down by the water, head down the loose/crumbly area from

Badgersaurus

to the anchors of fixed line. Rap the fixed line to the nice staging area below. Instead of climbing back up the ramp like

Fly Low

, this route gets going off the deck just to the left if you are facing up the ramp.

content.description:
An awkward start leads to fun, jug hauling. This route and

Pound Town

(to the right, and closer to the water) converge at the 3rd bolt. Unlike

Pound Town

that needs a stick clip, you can just stand and clip the first bolt to avoid a tumble into the creek.

The 3rd and 4th bolts along with the anchors are shared with

Pound Town

.
content.location:
This is the left one of the two lowest routes down by the water at Low Wire. As the guidebook shows a picture from across the creek, this and

Pound Town

are technically the two farthest right routes in the Low Wire area, even though they are all the way down by the water.

Head down the fixed line to a nice staging area, then scramble down to another staging area just below and closer to the water. (If you are looking up the fixed line, this area is down to the right by the water.)

content.description: This is the farthest left (when you head down the fixed line) and the hardest at Low Wire. It is often equipped for your burly pleasure starting with bolt three. The guidebook gave it 4 stars, so I did the same.
content.location: Head down the fixed line to the nice staging area. It's behind you, set back in the overhang. This is easily recognizable by the chalk that still remains after Kevin got the FA in 2013.

content.description:
This is another easy warm-up for the area with some traversing that also allows you to hang the draws for

Fly Low

(and even

Land of the Lost

, if you're adventurous!).

Belay from the second set of anchors for the fixed line being careful not to knock down loose rocks on climbers below. You are given the 1st bolt as soon as you set out heading left.

The first "exit" up an easier dihedral ramp to a set of anchors is yours for this route. They are shared with

Fly Low

. Should you wish to continue traversing on good horizontals, you'll reach the last couple of bolts and be able to head up to the anchors for

Land of the Lost

.
content.location: The start is down at the second set of anchors of the fixed line - just before you rap down.  Belay from there being careful with your stance and rope management as to not kick loose rocks down on climbers at the lower area.

content.description:
One of my friends says, "it's hyperclassic" when a route is a must do. The guidebook shows 4 stars and friends agree, so I'm posting this for them and for me. Give this one a shot. You can hang and retrieve your draws from the 5.9, so nothing can be lost.

Scamper up the ramper from the base of the fixed line to snag two bolts for safety status before climbing vertical. Trusting and semi-awkward moves for the takeoff from the ramp gets you into some great movement.

As you get up a few bolts and you're on the horizontal jug rests above, look right. As you to start getting to the same height as the anchors for the fixed line, start heading a bit more right because you are finishing and heading to the same anchors as the 5.9 "

Fly High

". Trending left and continuing into the 5.11 "

Land of the Lost

" would certainly make things interesting.
content.location:
Head down the loose, crumbly area to the fixed line. Rap the fixed line to the nice staging area below. Fly Low starts by climbing back up the ramp and clipping two bolts on the way before going vertical. If you start climbing immediately at the base of the fixed line, you'll be setting out on "

Land of the Lost

" or its trad variation by the same name.

content.description: Badgersaurus is slightly overhung on thin crimps.
content.location:
This is the rightmost line of bolts above the fixed line. It is 20 feet to the right of

Vagini

and is the first route you'll see approaching from High Wire.
